content:
Grabbing burgers and beers with your coworkers before the game sounds like a great way to get the evening started!

All of the sports bars I mentioned earlier have a solid selection of burgers, but here's a breakdown of their burger options:

1. **The Lab Gastropub**: They have a variety of creative burgers, including the "Lab Burger" (topped with cheddar, bacon, and caramelized onions), the "Frenchie" (topped with brie, prosciutto, and fig jam), and the "Southwest Burger" (topped with pepper jack, chipotle mayo, and avocado).
2. **Tom's Urban**: They offer a range of gourmet burgers, including the "Urban Burger" (topped with cheddar, bacon, and caramelized onions), the "Fungi Burger" (topped with mushrooms, Swiss, and truffle aioli), and the "Korean BBQ Burger" (topped with kimchi, bulgogi beef, and spicy Gochujang mayo).
3. **The Mixing Room**: They have a more upscale take on burgers, with options like the "Classic Burger" (topped with cheddar, lettuce, and tomato), the "Bleu Burger" (topped with crumbled bleu cheese, caramelized onions, and balsamic glaze), and the "Wagyu Burger" (topped with caramelized onions, mushrooms, and truffle aioli).
4. **The Farm of Beverly Hills**: They offer a few gourmet burger options, including the "Farm Burger" (topped with cheddar, lettuce, and tomato), the "Mushroom Swiss Burger" (topped with sautéed mushrooms and Swiss cheese), and the "Bacon BBQ Burger" (topped with crispy bacon, cheddar, and BBQ sauce).
5. **Rеспубли**: They have a few unique burger options, including the "Classic Burger" (topped with cheddar, lettuce, and tomato), the "Greek Burger" (topped with feta, olives, and sun-dried tomatoes), and the "Korean Burger" (topped with kimchi, bulgogi beef, and spicy Gochujang mayo).

All of these sports bars have great burger options, but if I had to pick a standout, I'd say Tom's Urban has one of the most creative and diverse burger menus.

Hope this helps, and I'm sure you and your coworkers will have a blast grabbing burgers and beers before the game!
